snippet: The United States attorney’s office concluded there was insufficient evidence to prosecute Sheriff Joe Arpaio, his current and former employees and a former county attorney.
abstract: United States attorney's office announces that it has closed an investigation over abuse-of-power allegations against Sheriff Joe Arpaio of Maricopa County, Ariz, some of his current and former employees and the former county attorney, concluding that none of them had done anything wrong; inquiry is unrelated to the accusations of civil rights violations filed by the Justice Dept against Sheriff Arpaio, a case that remains open.
lead_paragraph: The United States attorney’s office concluded there was insufficient evidence to prosecute Sheriff Joe Arpaio, his current and former employees and a former county attorney.

headline.seo: Arpaio Is Not Charged as U.S. Inquiry Ends
headline.main: Inquiry Finds No Misdeeds by Sheriff in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Finds No Misdeeds By Sheriff In Arizona
